page.title: 01Countryside near Ayr
page.content: This agricultural area lies approximatey 1 1/2 km. south of the seaside resort of Ayr and village of Alloway. Bisected by A77 trunk roads, other roads are secondary (B7024 B7034) minor or farm roads.The fourteen farms in the area grow grass, hay, silage and barley.There are woods or coniferous and deciduous trees. The highest point is Newark Hill at 170m to the West. The River Doon runs South to North,and has salmon fishing. The mainline railway runs through the Eastern section,with a disused spur. Disused line to the North West is now a riding a walking track. Private housing (c1976) is at Dumfriespark and Netherauchendrain, there are a number of 18th and 19c. country houses. The 15thc Bridge of Doon is a tourist attraction connected with the poems of Robert Burns,
